dialogue: That sounds terrible! Does that type of practice still occur?
Yes it does sadly.  Another fact is that it is said to be unfairly taking advantage of another person because of his or her inferior position

dialogue: That must be a hard way to live.
Psychologists agree that there are positive and negative aspects of it. It really does push me to do better, which is one positive aspect.
Pushing yourself to do better is always a good idea! Sometimes I honestly feel like I push myself too often.
It can be really hard. Nobody should push themselves too hard. It can be stressful.
Well when someone focuses on perfectionism they don't really take into account its affects.
I agree. Also very hard on the perfectionist person. Hard for them to accept if they don't make their goals.
Very true, they treat it like it's the end of the world.
I agree.  Do you set any goals for yourself?
Yes absolutely. Sometimes I believe my goals are too strict or hard to reach.
What kind of goals do you set? Like for work or what?
I set goals around my work and school. With school I force myself to shoot for the stars and I have to follow every regulation at work.
My daughter just graduated top of her class. She knows what that is like. She is a perfectionist too

No my daughter. She just graduated high school with honors

i work too much.

dialogue: No, I don't know anyone like that!  What do they do with the stuff that they hoard?

Oh wow. What does she say she wants with all those shoes?

Are they her shoes, or did they used to be yours? That seems a little odd!

I'm allergic to a lot of different things like shellfish, cats, etc. So something like I'll get scratched by a cat and die. Who knows!

Good for you. :) Life happened to me in a pretty rough way, so I'm currently in my folks' basement...but it's a place!
Hey at least you have your family close by! What happened if you don't mind me asking?
My roommate committed suicide two years ago, and I couldn't make the bills without her. But my parents let me save money, so I'm glad for them.

Do you think they will ever find a cure for the cold? It's so annoying.

hi

thats cool

the best part of it is going to universal studios to have a blast

its tuff i wish you luck.

its beautiful and its nice to use overall

oh ok will try good best

dialogue: Last week, my partner's mom passed away. It was truly hard for her to comprehend all the mixed feelings at that moment
I am so sorry to hear that.  Losing a loved one is definitely one of the hardest things in life.

Well, I have lost a grandparent as well, and most of the time you don't need to say anything - just be there.
That's what I've been doing, her family is all coming in, so I've been cleaning and getting food and stuff in
That's a good way to be supportive - anything to help her - especially to allow her more time with her family.  Does she like to draw?
Yeah, she does. But I'm a truck driver so I have to leave for a few days too. So hopefully her family will be here to help.
I would make sure that she has family for support and isn't alone.  Drawing is a good coping outlet for me - I draw my feelings and it helps
Do you suggest I get her a journal and pencils?
A drawing journal would be good so she could draw and write out her feelings.  Gives her a healthy way to release them
Yeah! I think thats great! Even one of those that have prompts for her to write or draw.
Yeah that's true, what does she usually like to draw?  You might encourage her to draw something she likes also to make her happy.
She likes to draw animals.
I always liked drawing animals too - I used to go to the zoo and sit and draw the animals.
speaker persona: i am a truck driver.
i know how to drive a stickshift.

its extremely fun!

oh yes i can imagine .

Yes , summer vacation is so nice she is not as stressed. I enjoy summer very much.

Yes she is working down at the local comic store, which is awesome our favorite hero is The Flash!

Working in Finance has it's benefits, I'm sure you'd be a great asset !

thats fair i also like coldplay as well as Radiohead, good english bands. And Korea Bands.

dialogue: not good . i'm trying to lose weight and i'm having trouble doing it .
i'm ray i just got back from the gym , i go on a regular basis
I would like to start going to the gym to help me lose some weight, but it's hard to get motivated? Any suggestions?
Hi I'm Ray. I am a physical fitness enthusiast. I believe eating healthy and exercising is a important.
I think exorcise would really help me. What do you use to keep yourself motivated?
I am very conscious of my weight, so that is one motivator. Also, I feel mentally better when I exercise. That alone is motivation.
That's a good point. I need to get on some sort of diet plan as well. I try for a few days then I get frustrated and quit.
Setting a goal each day is helpful. Even a little exercise and at least one healthy meal each day helps alot; chicken and rice is my favorite.
I love that idea of setting smaller daily goals. And I love chicken and rice.
I started going to the gym once a week, working up to 4 times a week. I also write down everything I eat. It helps to visually see the progress.
Yeah I could see that. Kind of like banking. Keeping track of everything so I can hold myself accountable
Exactly! Keeping healthy food in the freezer is also good. I make my favorites (chicken and rice!) and freeze it for easy use.
Another awesome idea! Thanks! Do you have special containers or something to freeze it?
I also budget like you! I use freezer ziplock bags so its easy and doesn't take much space. I let them thaw while I'm at the gym or work.
speaker persona: i am a very short woman.
i have trouble losing weight.

dialogue: Yes, he's been getting speech therapy since he was 2.
Great, speech or voice therapy is used to improve or modify the human voice. I am sure with time he can overcome his mild alalia.
Hi! I am Mary. I have two children. My oldest son has autism. He is 7 years old and is the light of our life.
Children really give us the opportunity to see they world in a new light. You are so blessed!
Indeed! It is a blessing to have a little human that loves unconditionally. It also gives our family the opportunity to grow by serving.
Yes, I can imagine. Family is one of the most important things in the world to me! Without them, I never would have survived my terrible motorcycle accident.
Wow! You too have your challenges! No one has a perfect life. Like my son, I'm sure you deal with physical and mental therapy to cope.
Yes, My whole left knee is filled with metal. I had to learn to walk all over again. Talk about humbling..
I'm so sorry, but thankful you survived. We all do our best in life. Although my son is not "normal", he too humbles us daily.
Yes, Mary, me too! Having children with developmental disorders is so hard, and unfortunately not everyone is understanding. Blessing to you and your family.
Thankfully there are many services and therapies available to help him and us as supportive parents. The schools have also been very helpful in his progress.
That's amazing.  I'll bet that some of the educational treatment works for sure.  You are definitely a hero for doing this.
Awareness for autism and support for autistic adults is definitely growing. The people working for this are my heroes!
That is so true! I think social media has helped spread a lot of awareness about how widespread the disorder is.
speaker persona: i've two children.
one child has autism.
listener persona: my family means the world to me.
my left knee is filled with metal.

Is there some sort of positive reinforcement you could try? Maybe a gift card to spend as she likes when she has not 'binged' for a specified length of time?
I  do from time to time. I bring her flowers and try to get her out of the house
Is there a better way to control your funds so she can't shop you out of house and home?
I hate to do this because she is my wife. But I'm thinking about setting up a seperate account.
I think that's a good idea. I would think she'll understand
speaker persona: our class is planning a trip to japan.
i hope to save enough money for it.
listener persona: there are thorns tattooed on my toes.
i've a rose tattooed on my right ankle.

dialogue: i did that soon after i graduated from high school . you must like animals .
i do . i'm in a band . maybe you can rap for me ?

i'm trying to remember what koalas eat?eucalyptus leaves?

Don't tell me you thin hippos are cute?They're killers.I think they kill more people each year in africa than crocodiles

well all baby mammals are cute. hippos,rhinos,elephants,leopards.you don't want to meet them when they are all grown up but as babies they're adorable

yes.which zoo were you at last year?
Toronto zoo in Canada. There was also pandas at the time which everyone was lining up to see.
that must have been great.pandas?let's see.they eat bamboo,right?
Yes they do. About 20-40 pounds of it each day. Which is rediculous don
speaker persona: i've a beard.
i drive a truck.

i volunteer at the local humane society.

o no, i hope no one noticed
that's why people were laughing all day
i've done worse.  i accidentally made the tea upside down at work
i  don't cook at all. I always have to eat out
i hate cooking too!!
I don't cook since I almost cooked my dog because i forget my contact lenses
wow!! thats crazy!! glad your dog is okay
i know!! I love my dog
i love dogs, i love cats more!!
i don't like cats, they so arrogant and think they are in charge.
i like them because im an introvert
do wear glasses or contact lenses?
i wear glasses, my eyesight is horrible!!

i don t cook and usually eat out.

do you speak any other languages other than english ?
I speak greek, slovak, polish, czech, russian, italian
That's really impressive you know so many, did you ever study languages scientifically, also known as linguistics?
i had to overcame cancer when i was 18
OH WOW! THat's insanse. It must have been hard having cancer at such a young age.
it was horrible, i am on low carb diet now
Does a low carb diet help? Do you feel healthier?
i feel amazing now
Awesome. I'm glad the low carb diet works. I love pasta too much to try it.
i used to eat out all the time and not exactly healthy so maybe that's why i had cancer.
Perhaps. I need to eat out less. It costs too much.
you can make pasta at home, it's cheap and easy to make.
Yeah. I do from time to time. I get a little lazy sometimes though. Plus their is a great mom & pop Italian resturant down the road from me.
speaker persona: i overcame urinary cancer at age 18.
i am on a low carb diet.
listener persona: i volunteer in my son s boy scout troop.

dialogue: I can't wait for saturday! We're going on a little family adventure
Oh cool! Where are you guys going?
hiking in some mountains nearby. I'm taking my dogs.
Sounds fun! Recently unemployed so going to add hiking in mountains on my list of to-do's. What dogs you have?
two terrier mixes, one black, one tan. they love to hike with me.
I bet that makes them very happy. Got a husky here who loves hiking.
I have a friend with a husky that loves to run long distances and hike too.
They love to pull so I have a great workout partner. Do you go on hikes often?
I try to. It's hard during the work week. But it's good to get my dogs out for lots of exercise.
I'm sure they love doing anything that involves moving around. What do you feed them?
More people food than I should ;-) actually they really love baked sweet potatoes.
I like that as well. Definately won't be giving doggo that. He sensitive.
my dogs were both rescues so they will eat anything they can. they must have been hungry a lot as strays.
Good on you for rescueing. I'm sure it was a hard time for the poor babies.
speaker persona: my two dogs are the best friends a girl could have.
i have a poster of neil tyson degrasse on my wall.
listener persona: i am currently unemployed so i've time to write.

dialogue: i don't get out much . you can tell . i know . have you ever lost a toe ?
no i haven't , my dads a stifle worker however .
What is a stifle worker? I have only 3 toes on my right foot. No problems with my job as a zookeeper.
I don't even know what stifle means. haha
Lol! Maybe ask your dad. I'm curious. The animals that keep me company don't care at all about my missing toes.
thats cool, what's your favorite animal?
In my home, my favorite animal is a dog. I have a shih tzu. At the zoo, my favorite animal is the elephant - gentle giant.
I love elephants.  Theyre one of the smartest animals.  They mourn their dead
I know! They are so very intuitive too. They seem to know how I am feeling and respond to it. Do you have a job?
no, I'm trying to get on social security.  I wouldnt mind caregiving though. super laid back
Caregiving is important. I imagine it takes a lot of patience and an attitude of service.
my roommate does it and i shadowed him, thats why i want to do it.  it's almost not a job what he does
What qualifications does it take?
a background check and pass an easy test that you get to study for
speaker persona: i'm a zookeeper.
my right foot only has 3 toes.
listener persona: i've a job as an it agent.

dialogue: i love school , dancing with friends , and running . what are your friends like ?
my friends are mellow but fun . where are you from ?
From Canada, yourself? Mellow as in down to earth im guessing.
USA
What are your hobbies? I really like being an employee.
I'm 71, too old for hobbies.
May as well tell me your too old for life haha. When was the last time you danced?
When I was around 8 years old.
I like to ask elderdy, any regrets from life?
my favorite food to harvest is carrots, perhaps I should have tried potatoes.
Why not try them all? I get most of my fruits and veggies from farmers markets.
Yes agree, I like the baby carrots there easier for me to eat.
Do you make any kind of veggie/fruit smoothies at all? Love waking up to that.
yes , i like fresh mango and orange juices
speaker persona: i love to be run.
i like to dance with my friends.
listener persona: my favorite food to harvest is carrots.

dialogue: do you know your father ? i've never met mine .
i do not either sadly . its much too common .
i might not know my whole family, but my friends treat me like family
That's awesome! I also have some very good friends. I am married also and have 4 children now. So blessed!
nice, i just have a boyfriend and we're not really the parenting type because we are kind of like kids ourselves!!
You may find that that will change as time goes on. I still act like a kid sometimes too as I drive a red sportscar and wear red converse shoes.
it wont change, i'm autistic
Oh wow! One of my son's is autistic. He is such a blessing to all of us. If you are like him, he is so intelligent and so loving!
i am, and im an empath.  its really intense sometimes!!
I can imagine! I am so thankful that there is such a growing awareness and appreciation for special souls like you and my son.
it took me a long time to accept my diagnosis, but im blessed now.  my partner also has it!!
That must be be both a challenge and a blessing. You understand each other!
i refused to have a partner like that before him, but it's way better this way
Thank goodness you found each other. Hopefully you are both benefitting from resources that enhance your lives.
speaker persona: i have never met my father.
i work in an animal shelter.
listener persona: i like to wear red shoes also.

dialogue: It is a small corner store, so I would say more like a convenience store. Lots of good snacks.
Does your "snacks" selection include beer and wine?
Does a bird have wings? Do Tornadoes spin?
Ha! what's your favorite snack while you are watching sports and drinking beer
Probably cheetos and pita's with hummus. How about you?
I like hummus and pita too. i also like to make wings in my pressure cooker.
Love those things. My mom makes wings like that every other week.
Yeah they are awesome. they cook fast in the cooker, then you add sauce and put them in the oven. do u like ranch or blue cheese better?
Blue cheese all day. Don't mind some buffalo or honey garlic either. You?
Blue cheese here too, with buffalo. And celery. The celery makes it practically health food.
Haha, ofcourse it does. Do you ever have potatoe wedges with wings? So good!
No, never tried that before. I usually like sweet potato fries better than regular fries or potatoes.
That was my mentality too. Until I started making homemade wedges with spicy sauce and tzaziki.
That sounds awesome! I love tzaziki. Never had it with fries before!

i'm still living at home at age 30.

i work as a yoga instructor . do you have any favorite musician ?
I love Madonna.
Madonna is awesome! Love her sense of style. Do you like Lady Gaga too?
no, i hate lady gaga, that's just too much for me.
speaker persona: this is my second year in the league.
this season , i will become a playoff quarterback.
listener persona: i am very health conscious , and i watch what i eat.

dialogue: i see . it is a comedy tennis movie , which i love as well . how many kids ?
2 kids . they're always needing clothes it seems
They never stop needing clothes, when growing or when adulting. Do yo play sports?
I am not much of  a sports buff. I spend a lot of time on the computer doing blogging.
Im not too active either just a little tennis with the family every week. What kind of blogs?
I mostly blog about peoples llifestyles. Where they travel, work, etc. Do you read any blogs?
Sounds like you learn a lot. Mainly fitness and business ones. Prefer videos.
Do you workout? I have recently tried yoga and I'm really enjoying it.
I try different classes often, you should try hot yoga. Never enjoyed it more.
What is hot yoga? I haven't heard of it. I also like to walk. I have 2 dogs so I do a lot of it!
As long as your moving! Hot yoga is yoga in a hot environment. You burn a lot of fat.
That sounds great! I could sure use to burn some fat!
As long as you keep moving around you will have no problem with that! Good luck!
Thank you for your suggestion!  I really like Hatha yoga, maybe  you could find a class.
speaker persona: my favorite color is green.
i like to play tennis.

dialogue: My dog died 5 minutes ago. I am so distraught.
That is a real bummer. Maybe you should take some time to reflect on their life.
She loved to go for walks. I went on many hikes with her that I wouldn't have done by myself.
I bet she was so happy doing that with you. It sounds like she had a good life and was well loved.
I live by the ocean and she loved the beach too. And belly rubs! Such a sweet dog, she never hurt any living creature.
Dogs become part of the family and losing them is so hard. Sometimes all you can do is know that your dog knew she was loved.
Thank you for understanding that she wasn't "just an animal". Do you have pets?
I have a scottish terrier mix. He is black and gray. He sleeps under the covers with me, so he's definitely spoiled. ;-)
Oh, sweet! It's so nice to cuddle with a pet when you're sleeping. My dog was too big but my cat sleeps in my arms :)
My dog likes to sleep right up next to me. Sometimes his snoring wakes me up. Do you think that one day, you would like another dog?
Oh yes, I'll need another dog to keep me hiking and to keep my cat company. They were best friends :/
We used to have a cat. Our dog always wanted to play with him. The cat would play...for about thirty seconds. Then he had enough.
Aw, poor doggie! They always look so sad when someone won't play with them. I hope they were friends otherwise.
They were. The cat just liked to mess with the dog! You know how cats are, always want to be in control.
They always ARE in control. Of the humans, too! ;)
speaker persona: i like wide , open spaces.
i only eat locally sourced food.

dialogue: no , i'm free every single day . i have no life .
you can walk my dog for me . i will pay you i .
I'd love to make some money walking your dog! How far do you walk him?
2 hours every morning. He is young and very playful
That would be great, I can do that. $50 per hour sound good?
$100 per walk is what you are asking correct? What was your last job?
Last job was $50 but I only walked them one hour.
I assume you are living in a  good neighborhood. You give training as well?
It's decent, middle class. I'll do my best to get him to sit, roll over and come if I can.
I wont be able to afford you but can recommend. You have been in this for a while?
I've been doing it for about 10 years, off and on.
Wow I am impressed. How did you end up having free time? People must be  in queue for you

I am impressed

Australia, can you recommend someone there?

Travelling around the northeast coast

I am planning to open a juicing bar on the beach

SurfnSmoothie :) Lets exchange contacts and see you there. You will love it I can assure you

To Thailand

No but I would love to go, it

It's on my bucket list, I went to New Zealand last year and it was amazing

I went for two weeks, it's such a long flight I'm glad I stayed the full two weeks

Sydney was a fun town and the scenery was beautiful

i enjoy reading.

Not many, he primarily wrote music for the solo piano but did not perform much.
I love that genre of music. Do you like jazz?
Yes! I really like jazz, blues, and swing - anything with a good piano does it for me. What about you?
Lately I have really been into '80s music. What kind of foods do you enjoy?
I'm really into korean lately. I spent a year there and it's all I think about now lol. How about you?
I love really hot chicken wings. I am from Buffalo so you almost have to like them!
My only problem with wings is that I'm lazy - I always opt for boneless if I can. Call me a sinner but hey, I just want to eat!
I absolutely understand. A lot less messy too! What do you do for a living?
I have my own clothing brand! I make my own clothes and make a decent side hustle selling them to others as well! You?
That sounds like a lot of fun! Right now I am driving a truck for a company in Florida.
How do you feel about our president moving to the state of Florida? I live in AL so it was a close call lol
It seems he feels people will be nicer to him in Florida. I will tell you that his house in Palm Beach is really something to see.

dialogue: i like to go all over . i have been local most recently however . what about you ?
i like to visit national parks

I usually just spend the day but camping would be fun.  I'd like to visit the Grand Canyon and camp there.
I didn't know you could camp there! Careful you don't fall out of bed & roll off the edge, it's a long way down. ;)
My husband has done a river rafting trip on the Grand Canyon, it's on my bucket list.
What else is on your bucket list?
I've never been to Yosemite either, it looks amazing.
Is that the place with the huge geyser?
No that's Yellowstone, I've been there.  The thing I loved the most about Yellowstone was the buffalo.
A home where the buffalo roam! Have you ever been to the Rocky Mountains?
Yes, my favorite.  I just got back from Rocky Mountain National Park.  It was beautiful in the fall.
Fantastic! I love Banff and Jasper.
Where is Jasper?
speaker persona: so i started a small business.
i recently graduated from college.

dialogue: Hello.
Do you like take-out? Its a concept found in many ancient cultures.
I didn't know it was going in all ancient cultures but yeah I do.
I am surprised that take out was a concept found in ancient cultures.  I thought it would have started in the fast food era.
I would think so too. Honestly I wouldn't know much anyway all I do is play video games.
what games do you like
I love dark souls. It's really hard but super satisfying. It takes my mind if of a lot of things.
my sons are pretty young but they are into Minecraft.
I love that game too. I'm glad they like it because Minecraft can really draw from creativity in someone.
Do you have any other hobbies?
Aside from working all the time I like to play virtual really for exercise.
what kind of work do you do
I set up architectural plans to be drawn on by designers digitally
that sounds cool. Is that CAD?
Sometimes but I mostly use Revit

i eat all take out.

i love to cook for my family and friends.

dialogue: I am still single and all of my friends are married or engaged.
Being single isn't all that bad. Are you looking for someone?
Yeah for sure. It's hard to find somone that shares my weird hobbies like surgery videos and anything sharp and dangerous haha
Seriously, hang in there you'll find someone.
Lol thanks - what are some of your hobbies? What do you think about mine?
I faint at the sight of blood so surgery videos are so not my thing.  I like to spend a lot of time outdoors.
Do you do a lot of hiking then? Maybe we share an interest in machetes or axes or knives?
I do carry a knife when I hike.  I never know what's coming around the corner especailly because I can't hear anything coming.
What kind of knife? What about when it comes to EDC or personal defense?
Just a pocket knife
Okay, but what about when it comes to personal defense? Or only just hiking?
I have never really thought about using a knife for personal defense
Not even that - they can be practical for opening boxes or cans in a pinch. Always good to have one :)
I agree.  You never know when you might need one in an emergency - never really thought about it like that.
speaker persona: i like watching videos of surgery.
i enjoy playing with edged weapons.
listener persona: i never learned how to drive.

dialogue: absolutely ! i moved here from virginia , and swim in the pacific everyday .
sounds amazing . i love the color blue , i'm picturing the clear blue skies and water .
It is really beautiful. What did your mom and dad do for a living?
We lived in an extremely rural area and it just was more practical for us. Also, my mom was an educator by profession.
My mom too! She is retired now, but was a school teacher for many years.
that is awesome, what is she doing now?
She is retired but she does knitting as a hobby and has gotten really good at it! She sells some of her stuff.
That's really cool! Does she sell any knitted items online?
Not yet, but I'm trying to help her. What does your dad do?
He's retired now, but he used to be an emu rancher.
Well that is an interesting profession. My dad was a police officer, he is also retired.
That can be a dangerous job. Did you worry about him when you were a kid?
I did to a degree, it wasn't as scary back then as much as it is now. Where was your dad a rancher?
The family ranch was in West Texas, but due to financial reasons, they had to sell it.
speaker persona: my mother was a teacher.
my father was a cop.
listener persona: everyday i go swimming at the y.

dialogue: I proposed to my girlfriend the other day and she said yes!
Nice and congrats! How long have you been together?
About three years. I am so happy!
That's great! Congratulations!
Thank you. I wish you as much happiness! Are you in a relationship?
I am! We are pregnant with twins! :) Due to minor complications the Dr. currently has me on bed rest.
That's fabulous, I mean the pregnancy not the complications! I hope you'll be feeling better soon.
Thank you so much! Any timeline on the wedding? Such an exciting and life changing event
We're thinking of doing it in the spring so the weather won't be too hot or cold. When are you due?
That's a great time for a wedding! I am due in December. We have about 5 weeks left to go and I can't wait. It's an exciting time of year!
Congratulations, you'll have a couple of baby Capricorns! ;)
OMG, I know! My brother is a Capricorn. One of my favorite personalities
Yes, you can always count on a Capricorn. My girlfriend is one as well.
They're the best! Congratulations again! Wishing y'all the best :)
speaker persona: i m not much of a fan of hot weather.
i like listening to all genres of music except country music.

i found out that i am carrying twins.

dialogue: I didn't know that! Are they easy to raise?
I am sure about the difficulty in raising them, however I know some people rear them for their meat
Really? That's interesting. Besides eating, what are your hobbies? Do you play runescape by any chance?
I don't play any video games to be honest.  I like to spend time outdoors.
I do too - unfortunately if I spend too much time outdoors my breathing acts up and I have to use my inhaler :(
That does make it tricky.  I spend a lot of time running, tying to keep in shape.
That's great. I spend time weightlifting and playing badminton - I'm in the best shape I've been in all my life!
Badminton - that's interesting.  How did you get into that?
I was born in the philippines and it has always been the only sport that interests me. My uni also has a club here!
Is it good excersice? I'm always looking for fun ways to keep in shape.
yes!!! it burns like 550 calories an hour. Have to be careful about your joints and racket arm though.
I'm in, have you ever played volleyball?  A girl who I was in pageants with introduced me to it.
Not for real - I don't like watching it nor playing it tbh. It takes skills though and makes for great lower body workout!
Its fast paced which is why I like it.
speaker persona: i love rpg computer games.
i need to use an inhaler sometimes.
listener persona: i have always wanted a pot bellied pig.
i won a beauty pageant one time but didn t feel like it was worth the effort.

dialogue: No, I never have. Who is he?
He is a Scottish sculptor and installation artist.
Tell me about your profession
He is a Scottish sculptor as well as an installation artist.
Art is so beautiful. As a chef I have the upmost respect for David Mach
Who is he that you are speaking about?
The one you speak of, the Scottish sculptor. I myself am a classically trained chef from baton roug
Wow, sounds pretty impressive!

i am a freelance musician and voice over actor
Thats cool! I love the fact that you work for yourself.
thank you , it was great getting to know you david .
Have a great day
You as well. Have a great day.

i was born in baton rouge.

i wish i had money to travel.

dialogue: I was nervous this morning driving. It was raining hard
Sometimes if the storm is severe enough, it's best to just pull over.
I guess your right, I'm always in such a hurry.
Yea, it's not enough that you drive safe sometimes.
I hope this rain stops eventually, we could use some sunshine.
Well, it's not all bad as rain helps with crop irrigation and provides water for hydroelectric power plants.
That's true but the sunshine is good for my soul.
i suppose you are right about that .
The kids love it too, I can't take rescheduling practice again this week.
Hopefully we will have sunshine this week then
The weather looks better towards the end of the week for sure.
Good. Do you have any plans for the weekend?
Lot's of soccer games scheduled but I would like to try and find sometime to get to the beach.
that does sound like fun . the beach is relaxing .
speaker persona: i am a soccer mom.
i work for a online company from home.

i have a cat named george.

dialogue: I was doing some cleaning and I some stuff that reminded me of when I thought I was going to be a millionare
Were they lottery and scratch off tickets?
No they were old beenie babies! My boyfriend in the army gave them to me before being deployed.
Are you going to sell them?
If they are of a good value. They are just sitting around now, I might as well!
Yea moneys tight, you might as well make sure extra cash. I got work tonight, kill me.
Lol that escalated quickly. Where do you work? I have to keep my hair short for my job :(
I work graveyard shift at some snobby hotel.
Must be tough.I work in catering so having short hair is just easier for sanitation. What do you do at the hotel?
Iv been a dishwasher for two years now. It pays the bills :*(
I understand that. As soon as the bf gets back home, I think I'll go back to college and get a masters!
I think thats a really great idea. Im working to go snowboarding. I love the snow!
where do you want to go snowboarding? climate change is making it harder to do that :(
Im actually really happy that your talking about climate change. I usually go to orangeville in ontario
speaker persona: my hair is short.
my boyfriend is in the army.
listener persona: i work graveyard in a hotel.

dialogue: That is funny, because I am also a vegan.  Are you a dietary vegan?
Yes, I am a dietary vegan.  I refrain from consuming all animal products.
How long have you been vegan? I have been for about 10 years now.
I'm relatively new. only 18 months
As time goes on you will get more creative with meals. I love to read vegan cook books in my spare time.
i haven't read many. do they give you tips on alternative options?
Yes they do! I have even made some delicious vegan desserts using chick peas!
Yum! well i need to start looking on amazon for what's available
Amazon is a great place to find cookbooks. You can download the kindle too.
i don't have a kindle. still old school with paperback books

make you feel like you've fulfilled a task
Exactly! What do you like to read?
i really enjoy thrillers and law based books
speaker persona: i like to read.
i am a vegan.

dialogue: do you enjoy cosplay ? i do
what is that ? not sure
It's where you dress up like characters in movies, tv, or video games.
Oh sure, I love dressing up! Did you dress up for Halloween? I was a space alien.
Yeah I dressed as a friar. I had a robe left over from the last renaissance fair I went to.
I love the old fashioned theme. What was your favorite thing at the fair?
Well, I enjoy the whole experience... But I REALLY like to watch the jousting contest. It's crazy!
Jousting? Sounds a bit dangerous! Have you done it yourself?
We used to bicycle joust using hockey sticks when I was a kid, but I never tried the real thing.
I love the look of the renaissance costumes. Maybe I'll try it myself sometime. Do they sell mead? I love mead.
They do! I've only had it once or twice. Are there any brands that you'd suggest to a newbie?
Sorry I'm a newbie myself, only had it at a dinner party once. Would love to try again though
That's OK. It's not something you see too often.
No, that's why I was curious about the fair. The costumes are beautiful too. How many fairs have you been to?
I've only been to a few. There's a pretty great one in Waxahatchie TX every May. You should check it out!
speaker persona: i love watching tv and movies.
i have been to a few renaissance fairs.
listener persona: we will be traveling to niagra falls for our honeymoon.

dialogue: my mom is a nurse and she's good at what she does . cool .
my mom lives over in seattle and i visit her whenever i can
I've never been to Seattle but I love the Coast
I love to take road trips so I visit when I can. Being a meeting coordinator offers me the ability to do so :)
Me too, I like to stop at interesting places along the way.  One time I spent a week following the Oregon Trail.
What about any other trails? And wow the famous oregon trail lol. Ever played the game?
Oh my gosh I love that game.  Played it as a kid - it was what got me into history in the first place
Really? That game was past my generation and i just know of it because of the books lol
Too bad it was super fun, I wonder if there is still a version of it out there.
I'm sure there is, did you ever make it to the end tho?
I can't remember I just remember I loved the adventurous part of the game.
Have you ever done any traveling outside of the states?
I just got back from Australia it was amazing, how about you?
Where in AU? I just got back from a year in Korea!
speaker persona: i am a technician.
i love history.
listener persona: i work as a meeting coordinator.
i love to take road trips.

dialogue: got any pets ? i bet they play tennis better than you .
i've a dog . my love for animals knows no bounds
I actually love all animals. I grew up on a farm.
Thats really cool. I grew up in the city so iv only seen small pets. What animals did u have on the farm?
Oh we had a lot. Cows, pigs, and we even had a donkey.
WOW! I grew up with donkeys on the streets.
Where are you from? Do you have any hobbies?
Im from India but iv been living here since I was 6. I love watching basketball and listening to music. Hbu
I love music too.I would love to be a professional singer.
What type of music do you like? I listen to rap and hip hop.
I'm more into jazz and the blues. I love to sing the blues, lol!
Thats really cool. Hey it been great talking with you!
It has been great talking with you!
Enjoy the rest of your day!
speaker persona: i love animals.
i'm an aspiring singer.
listener persona: i love to watch ted talks.

dialogue: Definitely! Who started the whole rock and roll genre of music?
Gee, I don't know if it was one person only. It has it's roots in blues rock and psychedelic rock. Then then heavy distortion was added along with the extended solos.
i'm from tennessee so very interested in its origins
I'm from Kentucky and my parents still live there. You'd think I would love bluegrass but metal is my favourite :)
that is surprising. Metal is a little too intense for me
One positive thing about metal is that it has its roots in blues. Do you like blues music?
i love blues singers. I don't know many of the guitarists and drummers of the genre
You may have heard some of them, here's a few: Joseph Williams (vocals), David Paich (keyboards), Steve Porcaro (keyboards), and Steve Lukather (guitars).
i know the Steves but don't know their songs or music
Never heard Africa by Toto? That's Steve Porcaro
oh no way. yeah love Africa. never knew who played that haha

i'm 33 so know Africa from the radio
Rosanna's a good song too, but sounds so much like Africa
speaker persona: i've a black lab.
i am from tennessee.

dialogue: I really miss my old house sometimes
I know the feeling. Why did you move
Me and my gf broke up. I was weak and selfish, but it was time for a change.
Wow, way to accept responsibility.  All you can do is move on.  What makes you miss your old house?
I think of my memories with her. My heart hurts still but it was a broken relationship and was a matter of time I think.
Best that you are in a new place.  How long ago did you break up?
It was about 2 months ago. We had been dating for over a year though. Enough about me though, what about you?
I've dated here and there but still looking.  I'm thinking of starting my own business and that takes a lot of my time
What kind of business? I'm a bit of an entrepreneur myself.
Baking has been my hobby for a long time but I'm thinking of jumping in to making cakes maybe start small with catering gigs.
Oh wow! I shoot wedding photo/videos. My whole life is just about love I guess lol
That must make it hard watching all those people in love and going through a break up.
It gives me hope if anything. Sometimes I'm jealous but it reminds that in our casual sex-laden world, real love exists still.
It sure does - you'll get there.  I'll make your wedding cake when you do.
speaker persona: my heart hurts from a broken relationship.
i am weak and selfish , but i want to change.
listener persona: my mother is a retired teacher.

dialogue: Yeah she was a great dancer and also a great actress I think. I think her death really made Alzheimer's more well known.
I think my favorite thing she did was being a pin-up girl in WW2. She performed for the GIs :)
Its always sad to see someone so admired and respected to pass away.
It really is. She really meant the world to me, I used to dream about meeting her!
Keep your head up. Just remember her for what she stood for.
I really do. My mother has Alzheimer's so I understand the disease.
My grandfather did as well. Its really sad to see them deteriorate like. Science is getting better so there is hope.
I do believe that there is hope. I am sorry its taking so long to respond, I wish my computer was a bit faster.
Its all cool. Did you know my character has three thumbs.
What character are you referring to? Three thumbs, I am intrigued!
Me. I have three thumbs. Lol. Hey bud its been great talking to you about Alzeimers
It was great talking to you also!
Have a great day!
You as well!
speaker persona: i've 3 thumbs.
i like the color red.
listener persona: rita hayworth is the woman of my dreams.
sometimes i wish my computer would work faster.

dialogue: Oh, I really like their music too!  I didn't know they were from Illinois.
Yea they started in Chicagos ha rdcore punk scene
I love fall out boy
I do too - my two cats don't seem to like their lol
Haha, I think cats prefer easy listening ;)
Maybe - or maybe its the kale I'm always feeding them LOL
Kitties on kale? Mine would start a revolution :D
LOL. I LOVE Kale and it's super healthy. Try sneaking it in with some tuna or salmon. How many cats do you have/
Five! They grew up together so they love each other and never fight. How about you?
OMG WHAT? I have just two. They're a handle enough already. What are their names?
Fred, Wilma, Barney, Betty & Bam Bam, What about yours?
Korean names! 미소 and 아름, or smile and beauty respectively!
Oh those are beautiful names! How old are they?
Smile (miso) is 3. Beauty (areum) is 2!
speaker persona: i listen to a fall out boy record every day.
i love watching sitcoms on television.

dialogue: i just moved here from australia . i am having trouble making friends .
its ok i can be your friend for now
I can be your friend - do you play any sports?
I am an avid cyclist. And its  good thing because I eat a lot of pizza!
My favorite food is macaroni and cheese.  I just got a new bike do you want to go for a bike ride?
I would love to go for a bike ride! Maybe we can stop to eat afterward.
Sounds fun there is a candy store on the way to the park.
Well that sounds fabulous. I love chocolate covered potato chips!
Gummy worms are my favorite and they have an air hockey machine.
I haven't played air hockey in years! We had one in our basement when I was a kid.
So fun, I hope my parents get a pool table
Pool is fun too. However, I am terrible at it. Maybe you could give me a lesson.
They have one at the summer camp I'm going to.
Summer camp sounds interesting. Where do you go?
speaker persona: i'm in 3rd grade.
i don t have too many friends in the us yet , but i'm going to summer camp and i hope to make friends then ! i also think that i may make friends as soccer in the fall.

dialogue: it is great for any age . do you have any animals ?
no animals , i am still working on finishing my degree in the arts
Yes, I have three dogs.
Oh ok nice in Dublin Ireland I have a sheep dog
I've never been to Dublin before but I hope to get there someday.
It’s beautiful here just me mom dad and penny my dog
What is your favorite food?
Ill try anything but definitely nachos
Ooo, nachos are good! My favorite food though is a chocolate milkshake with fresh whipped cream and a cherry on top.
Oooh chocolate milkshake nice choice delicious
I bike to work everyday on my red bike so that I can justify having chocolate shakes, Haha
Lol that’s a good one I work from home since I take care of mom and dad full time
You're so good to take care of your parents. There are too many people that wouldn't do that.
Yes you are right about that!
speaker persona: i ride my red bike to work everyday.
i love chocolate milk shakes.
listener persona: i m 49 , male and live in dublin , ireland.
i take care of my mother and father.

dialogue: i loved taking care of my sisters pet
Is it a lizard?
No, my sister has three dogs.I have a dog myself as well so we get along well.
Three dogs! Big or small? What breeds?
Corgi, Golden Retriever and a Shiba Inu. I have a German Shepard named sparkles
Nice, I love German Shepherds! Cute puppies and big playful dogs when they grow up.
Do you have any pets?
I have five cats. They grew up together so they love each other and never fight. :)
Thats so cute! My sister dogs get along with my little guy as well.
That's great they get along! Pets provide us with so many emotional and physical benefits. Mine are family as I'm sure that yours are as well!
My brothers song has ALS and he has a guide/support dog. They are really wonders.
That is really sweet! They are such amazing companions. They also help in hunting, aiding people with hearing issues, and search and rescue efforts!
Yup. We have domesticated animals to provide us benefit.
A lot of them benefit from it too. My cats are pretty spoiled :)
LOL. Been great talking to you
speaker persona: i'm content with my life.
i own a dog who is my best friend.

dialogue: My new best friend has already found a better best friend than me.
That sounds bad. Do you feel lonely now?
I feel a bit lonely but I spend a lot of time with my family. We love watching Netflix movies.
That's nice that you have family to spend time with. I love Netflix
Do you spend time with your family? What do your parents do for a living?
They're retired and getting older.  I help around the house and make sure they are Ok, they need more help then they used to.
It is tough seeing your parents get older. My father is still working at a very prestigious job.
That's nice what does he do?
He is a dean at a college in Vermont. My mom is retired now.
Do you visit them if Vermont often? It's so pretty up there.
I love it this time of the year. The leaves are absolutely amazing!
I also love it in winter, skiing is the best.  They have great pastries in Vermont.
Believe it or not I have never skied. Maybe you could take me sometime.
Perfect we can stay at your parent's house, I'll just need to get someone to stay with parents
speaker persona: my father has a very prestigious job.
i enjoy watching netflix with family.
listener persona: i really like cake and don't prefer vegetables.
i take care of my mother and father.

dialogue: Im the worst person to talk about dancing with...any kidn. I have two left feet!
I am not very good at it either! I just like to have fun! Salsa music arose in NYC in the 1960s!
That's so cool!
Oh, I'm so hungry! Want some pizza!
Pizza sounds so good! Someday I hope to travel to Italy and try authentic pizza and pasta.
Pizza is the best! I never get tired it. That and Thierry Henry. I love soccer!
Do you play soccer?
No, I just watch it. I have 2 left feet, LOL! How bout you?
Lol! I have injured myself in my sleep so...yeah I am not a sports playing person.
ROFL! Yeah, I fell out of bed once. I know what you mean. I like the gym though!
What is your favorite gym exercise?
I like the heated pool. It is perfect for lazy people, LOL! What about you?
Haha! Yeah I like the pool for that same reason. I also like weight machines.
Weight machines are good. I like the treadmills too.

i've a passion for god.

dialogue: That's neat. Astronomy and constellations are really cool. I'm a Leo myself.

Some people don't believe in star signs and think it's nonsense. However most of my characteristics are highly relatable to my star sign. What about yours?
i love astronomy and zodiac.  Ever since I've been a child, I've been fascinated about how we are connected in that way.
speaker persona: my hair is a reddish brown.
i am a competitive ski racer.

WOW!  All by himself in one sitting??
You can't believe what I see at the store.
I am a runner so I can pretty much eat whatever I want, I just burn it up.
I wish I could, I need to run more.  What's your favorite food?
My favorite food is Chinese. What about you?
I like snack foods the most - Fritos, pretzels, popcorn washed down with a Dr. Pepper.
I take medication that makes me very hungry! I love snack food also.
Good thing you can burn it off with all that running.
I will never give up running, unless my knees give out.
I hear that starts to happen as we get older.  Better pick up something that is easier on the body.
I would love to try cross country skiing. I just don't want to live in the cold climate year around.
I do like warm weather best - how about snorkeling?
I live in Florida and snorkel all the time. We have some great reefs.

i got married when i was your age to my sweat heart from high school

It's definitely a lot of work especially when we are outnumbered by kids.
speaker persona: i'm strong.
i am young.
listener persona: i need a soda with me at all times.

dialogue: I had to leave my dog at the vet overnight, so they can run some tests. She hasn't been eating much lately, and she's just been really lackadaisical and lazy. I don't think I'll be able to sleep tonight, knowing she's there in a weird environment, all alone
Aw, I'm sorry to hear that, is she getting up there in age?
She is 7 years old and usually a very energetic dog. She runs up and down the beach close to where I live.
We get so attached to our animals. I love the beach, I am planning on taking a cruise somewhere hot and sunny. I have never been on a boat before.
Oh cruises are a great idea.  I highly recommend it!  Lots of great food and things to do.  Where are you thinking of going?
Maybe Aruba or Bermuda. I'm not sure yet? Can you suggest somewhere that you like?
Dominican Republic, Curacao and Turks & Caicos are splendid.  Beautiful and relatively safe.
They all sound lovely. Do you have any hobbies or interests?
Yes.  I design and sew clothing.  Also write books and act in TV & Film.  How about you?
That sound like so much fun! I'm not very creative but I do love to shop on the weekends when I'm off from work.
Shopping is fun!!!  Love it too!!
Do you like going to the mall? We have a beautiful mall where I live.
I love going to the mall.  Is your mall very big?
It is very big. They just put a few million dollars into fixing it up. They even have valet parking.
Sounds like it would be a great time.
speaker persona: i live near the ocean.
i only wear tennis shoes.
listener persona: i love to shop on weekends.
i have never been on a cruise ship.

dialogue: i work too much for cats but i do love them !
they're the lazy little masters of the human race

Same! Travelling to work takes forever and honestly they need a lot maintenance
For sure! It wouldn't be fair to have a cat and leave it alone all day.
i know right ? do you work ? Sometimes i have lazy days and it wouldn't be fair on the cat
I am a basketball coach and I work literally all day every day, life is non-stop for me!
Same goes, I'd assume your diet must be important for your job. I eat healthy to stay in shape also!
I definitely eat healthy, it's so important to stay in shape! The exercise helps too though. Do you work?
Yeah in the city and transport is draining there! I avoided all meat forms - started eating green and clean :D
Good for you! I am vegan myself.
Honestly I tried going vegan but it was too hard for me. What made you go vegan?
I was vegetarian for most of my life for moral reasons, but recently I completely cut out animal products and I feel so much better for it!
that is great ! i think people can do anything so good for you !
I have so much more energy now when I'm playing sports!
speaker persona: i like basketball.
i work many hours.

dialogue: Yes, The 2009 population for the city proper was approximately 8.84 million people. Now approx 21.3 million
That is true. Mexico's economy is also very important to the Americas
What do you do for work?
I work in IT for a large multinational company.  How about you?
I am a cook at a diner. It's your typical diner food plus my specials.
I love diners.  What's your signature dish?
My signature dish is cranberry chutney pork chop with crispy mashed potatoes and garlic beans
Oh that sounds wonderful.  I'd definitely try it if I ever visited.  How long have you been there?
15 years, I worked my way up from host to cook.
That's great.  You must be a great cook.  Would love to come to your diner.
Anytime you find yourself in the area, definitely stop by. What is your favorite color?
Red is my favorite color.  Yours?
I love shades of blue.
Blue, like the ocean waters of Mexico.  Beautiful
Yes! I love blue waters.
speaker persona: i've a terrible singing voice.
i'm a short order cook at a local diner.

dialogue: What? That's horrible!! I can't believe it! Where?
It still exists in some countries in Africa, I believe in places like Mauritania for instance.
I can't believe slavery would still exist anywhere in the world.
It's awful! My husband did a charity organisation to bring awareness and help those who were affected
It really is. I know from first hand experience how it is to be a slave. I am so thankful to no longer be in that situation.
No, I'm so sorry to hear that! It would be rude to ask but when exactly was this?
I was a slave for 10 years in Africa. I escaped 5 years ago from Africa with the help of these Christian missionaries.
Before I met my husband he was also involved in these, however he can't travel due to responsibilities here
He was involved in missionaries?
Yeah he works at the local Church and he did some work with missionaries. But the little ones don't let him go
That is amazing. I owe my freedom to people like him. I definitely understand kids keeping him home now.
What about yourself? Any significant other? I'm just happy you escaped and started a new life here!
Yes, I met my husband here 2 years ago. Thank you. I truly have  a great life now. We are hoping to have a child soon.
Good luck, I think that's fantastic!! Do you think you would adopt, have a surrogate or try donor insemination?
speaker persona: my favorite color is red.
i was a slave for 10 years.

dialogue: I was in awe at the driving ability of my aunt, she's old but she still has it!
Right on! That's cool to hear. Everyone likes to rag on older people driving. Glad to hear she's the exception. What kind of car does she drive?
She drives a Subaru Outback.
Oh that's a fun car.  I drive a Cadillac Escalade.  It's a big car.
Yeah the Escalade is big.  I bet it is a plush drive.  How long have you had the Escalade?
I bought it in March.  I love it.  It's not a common vehicle in Tokyo.
Yes, I would imagine there are not many Escalades in Tokyo.  How long have yo lived in Tokyo.
10 years.  I've seen a lot of changes in this city.  Have you been?
Sort of.  I once had a layover at the Tokyo Airport when traveling from Singapore to Los Angeles.
Where were you born?
I was born in Trenton, New Jersey.  Where were you born?
Philadelphia, PA.  City of brotherly love.
I grew up just outside of Philly in Levittown PA
Yes. I know it well.  Flyers are my hockey team!
I'm still a Phillies and Eagles fan.
speaker persona: my favorite show ever is game of thrones.
i love watching tv and movies.
listener persona: i live in japan and own the biggest mansion in the country.

dialogue: I know I will get an A on my test.
Yes you will with that attitude
I have to! Or I might fail the class
You had best make sure you study really well. I believe you will find a way
Thanks! How are you doing in your classes?
well i get straight a s all the time in class so doing well
That's awesome! I have never really been a straight A's student. I have always had a lot on my plate anyways.
i use to spend lot of time couponing so i could donate stockpile to charity but spend it all studying now. You should be proud of your grades
oh wow, couponing? thats cool! must have been a lot of work. I have had a lot of time dedicated to playing music. I play bass
That is awesome. I wish I could play an instrument but my talents seem to be with numbers which is why I am great at couponing.
That's useful! I would love to learn how to coupon better
Find a copy of the ABC nightline episode extreme couponing to give you some tips. Love doing it so I can donate to help others.
That's so sweet. I might look into that, it seems interesting. I like the idea of saving money in general
Me too! I love saving money
speaker persona: i play bass.
i've a french bulldog.
listener persona: i donate any overstock to charity.

dialogue: I'm always ready for anything

Right, you never know.
Where do you live?
In Florida, what about you.
Same.  I'm in Naples, FL
Do you get to enjoy the sunshine much?
Yes.  It's often sunny here.  What city are you in?
Tampa area.
Are you a TB Lightning fan?
No, not really a big sports fan at all anymore. But I have been to some games.
They are fun to go to.
Actually they are. The excitement from everyone there is really fun. I do prefer the football games better though. Have you ever been to a game?
never to an NFL game
You should really go if you get a chance. The fans are great.
speaker persona: i like to sew.
i like to hunt for my food.
listener persona: ferrari is my favorite car company.

dialogue: I was cleaning out my bathtub drain this morning with bleach and hot water. My cat has never done this before but she jumped in and got covered in bleach and water.
Oh my that must have been frightening! Poor little cat, what happened afterwards?
She jumped straight out and ran away. It took forever to catch her, and I had to rinse her off afterwards
It ran away? I hope it did not get hurt in the process.
No, she is doing fine now. Such a crazy kitty. Have you ever had any problems with your pets?
Yeah.  It was sad.  One day my two cats decided they hated each other after years of no problems.
What? that's quite strange. how long have you had your cats?
It was like 8 years. I don't have them anymore.
Aww. I just got my kitty a couple months ago. I saved up money to get her. She's a british blue
Sounds so cute. What personalities do British blues have?
Well, I am no cat expert, but they make good house cat's and mine is quite calm
Sounds like the perfect cat.
Yes, it has been my dream cat for a while. Such beautiful big eyes
Are they expensive?  You said you saved up?
yes mine cost about $500
speaker persona: i am a factory worker.
i want to be in a band someday.
listener persona: i like watching tv and movies.
my favorite type of music is metal.

you must have been annoyed!!
Yes.  It is a common thing that's been happening lately
Where are they taking your paper from?
the front door.  I set up a camera to catch them next time
That
where are you from?
usa and you?

Naples means New City in Italian
Yes.  Have you ever been?
I have but it's been over 20 years ago.
Are you into sports?
Not so much. Are you?

my class has 26 kids.

dialogue: My dog pooped on the rug yesterday. I was so mad!
Is your dog still a puppy?

They will definitely do that.  What type of dog?
she is a black lab and just turned 10 . Spoiled a bit because I work from home doing editing so she gets lots of attention and walks
Must still act like a puppy.  Labs are so nice.
yes she acts like she is still a puppy sometimes especially when she sees a squirrel
LOL.  I had one growing up.  I miss him.
I got her in England . She cost a bit to bring to states but worth it all. Had a cat when she was a puppy but guess she forgot
They get jealous easily
Hopefully they will learn to get along with each other  and she wont have more intentional accidents in the house
They will end up being best friends before you know it
sure hope so . I have missed having a cat around. I had my last one for 17 years
The last cat I had passed awy young and never got another
speaker persona: i work at home , editing.
i have a cat.

dialogue: i am , thank you . where do you live ? i am in a rural area .
i live in the suburbs in new jersey .
ohh thats a cool city!why is it named so?
I'm not sure. Maybe because there was an old jersey maybe?? lol
I have been volunteering in the states since past 13 years but never been to new jersey
I mean it's pretty cool if you like a lot of people, but I'm mostly at work looking at computer screens.
thats so boring i cant do that for a living to be honest,i love to explore other cities
I'm guessing you travel alot that must be fun!
yeah, but now says i should not travel and rather focus on our health as we are too old to travel
Yea, heatlh is important. I'm trying to cut back on sugar and exercise more myself.
my husband also tells me to do so,he is health consious afterall
speaker persona: i m a older woman.
i love helping people.

truth be told the multiple reflections from walls enrich the sound of the persons voice. a lot of people feel american idol worthy after singing though

I am fine in the choir but for sure am not a soloist!
Yes I could do a choir. It would need to be big so I could hide in the back.
lol...
Are your alto, soprano or what?
alto.

Well, I was in the church choir. I no longer am though.
Interesting. I used to play keyboard for a church.

No time.  It took a look out of my schedule to learn the songs.

if i m not drinking , i m thinking , which makes me uncomfortable.

I'm just kidding.  Coors is trash. Now Molson is where it's at! Been brewing in Montreal, Quebec since 1786!
You have been brewing since 1786!
Yeah! It beer that good keeps going
Other than drinking Coors i am actually a car salesman, any chance you might be interested in a car?

Cars ranging from about $5000-$150,000

I actually play for the detroit lions

9 ball if i remember correctly, though its hard to remember since billiards is a bit of a blanket term for all cue sports.

My birth mother taught me. She use to be in the pool halls alot.

why what did you do ?
I was drunk and I was scared...

I'm not talking about the hot-dog situation... I left them there. They were laying on the ground. I don't know if they were okay.
Just come clean I know you did it. It is like a scene from my favorite horror novel.
I don't know if I'm ready to accept the consequences. It is not my first offense. I know it's my fault, but I'm so stressed out.

dialogue: I always try to be ready for things when I travel.

I wish I did miss the UK. I left it when I was 3. I hardly remember it. I want to visit it.

yep.  if you don't have the money don't be thinking you're going to get the help you need.  it's unfortunate, really.
I agree. We have insurance, but we still pay over $10,000 out of pocket every year. It is quite depressing.
glad you've got some insurance.  if i had the money i'd go to the street to get what i need, that's how bad it is
I am so sorry to hear that. I will say some extra prayers for you.

i love eating kale.

that's a great movie ! my favorite would be moan my kids love it !

How many children do you have?

Yeah it can be lonely for children sometimes, But my daughters friends practically live at our house anyways haha.
Yes, I know. My daughter has a lot of friends too, and they play at our house a lot too. They also have sleepovers.

i love to work in my garden.

no i'm in texas

my dad died when i was in high school

He was shot in the line of duty
I am so sorry for your loss!
I can only listen to metal music
Metal is the best!!

I love good head banging music!!!!!
me to

i am in high school.

dialogue: My vehicle was involved in a crash
Are you okay?
Yes, I'm okay. I feel really lucky.
That's good to hear. Glad you're ok.
Thank you. It was scary, but nobody is hurt.
I sure hope you are ok.  Traffic collisions often can cause injury, even death.
I'm always careful about making my family wear seatbelts.
Definitely! Seatbelts are life saving devices for sure.  Never know when they will be needed.
Do you drive?
Yes I do.  Everyday
Me too. It's usually so boring. Do you listen to the radio?
Can't drive without it!  Usually bluetooth my music files and listen to various playlists I have.
I love listening to music.
same here ! what kind of music do you listen to ?

i love to eat pita bread with hummus.

I know it is a major climbing destination, but I did not know that it is part of the National park. Very interesting!
mmh.  such a beautiful mountain.  don't know about the rest of the park, tho
It is! My husband read a book about it from Ernest Hemingway. He said it was a great book!
i remember the story, The Snows of Kilimanjaro", such a powerful piece:  "there.  there is where we are going".  <nods>
Yes! I will have to read it. Have you every visited Africa?
no, never.  you?

yeah.  but i'd be afraid.  the politics, the uncertainty, etc.  it would have to be a very well prepared group for me to go ...

i see.  yeah, i'd also be worried about the animals, but get your drift.  so you like animals, huh?
I understand you anxiety about going. That is how my husband feels. Yes, I love animals.
do you have any pets?

both my parents were teachers.

It is a language in itself that involves  acquisition, communication, and of sharing information and ideas

my favorite singer is jacob sartorius.

good ! glad you all are safe . so whats your hobbies now ?

i would love to be able to have horses

we have two pets as well.

those are seriously the best ! i do them all the time with my kids

awesome! congrats

Aspiring writer and work part time as a bartender

dialogue: i work at sears
How do you like it?  Do you happen to work at one in Indiana?  The first Sears store ever built was in Evansville, Indiana.  I'm sure it was quite the affair at the time.
nope, i'm in texas; there's a sears in irving.  evansville, huh?  did not know that
i remember shopping at sears  many times. and now they're almost gone,like Blockbuster, another business killed by the internet
yeah.  i keep hearing they're about to go completely under.  o well, i don't really want to sell washing machines at sears, anyway :(
i remember my parents taking me to sears and buying me a basketball when i was little.its probably why basketball is my favorite sport
o yeah?  yeah.  some stores play big in my childhood memories, too.  woolworth's, for instance.  no b-ball, tho ...
i remember woolworths.wow.i hadn't thought of them in years.i cant believe toys r us and kb toys are gone.thanks to private equity firms and leveraged buyouts
i wouldn't know why they're gone, i just remember my first experience of an escalator was in one.  so, you know something about business?
i know a little.what s your favorite sport?

what did you replace tv time with?tell me it was reading novels.id respect you so much for that
no.  i mostly caregive my elderly mom who has alzheimer's.  and formalisms.  math, mainly.
oh.i respect you even more for doing that.i now that must be hard for you, physically and mentally
speaker persona: i love the band red hot chili peppers.
i want to be a journalist but instead i sell washers at sears.

i am in college.

I live in Chicago as well and I really enjoy the chill factor of the winds!

no, i guess not.  been on a walk for alzheimer's last year tho.  no food, no rides, no crafts

i'm glad to hear it.  i caregive my mom.  she's just recently forgotten one of my sisters, so it's a slow progression
Your mom is lucky to have you, take lots of pictures and videos. I wish we would have taken more of my Nana.
yeah.  these are what's left - memories.  so how are you/your family otherwise these days?  well?

well, i hope you have a lot of fun.  make those memories, the pennies and figures are ephemeral

i want to move.

yeah, healthy dogs are happy dogs, and these are happy dogs.

my daughters both love crafting and they are good at it .

what kind of food do you like?

Calculus 1?

I haven't read anything of his.

i like cooking healthy meals.

dialogue: I can imagine those little Corgis carrying the rings.I wonder where this tradition got its start?
Well is a formal wedding the ring bearer is a special page who carries the rings on a pillow.
My St.Bernard will be carrying the ring in a tiny little beer barrel attached to his collar.
Yes great idea what kind of dog is he, I had a dog growing up I loved Buddy he was a greater swiss mountain dog.
I believe we are talking about the same breed of dog. They were a rescue dog designed for high altitudes.
I wonder how many movies they have made about these rescue dogs.

I would love to attend the wedding. I can attend any time thanks to my schedule.

dialogue: I was at the grocery store yesterday and did something I am not proud of. The cashier gave me too much money back and when I realized it I didn't say anything and kept it.
Did you need the money for something specific?
No, but I had already left the store and I figured "why bother?"
That makes a lot of sense. Sometime that's just how it goes though.
Yeah, I mean, the cashier has a bit of leeway. Don't they?
Sometimes. I suppose it depends on the store policies.
Well, like I said- I'm not proud of continuing on my way. I should have returned to the store.
You still can if you it's something that's still bothering you.
I wouldn't dare. I'd be so humiliated if anyone else knew!
It's not something to be embarrassed about. It happens all the time, and may clear the name of the cashier. It may also make you feel better about it.
You may be right.
Just do what you feel would be best.
I'm sure I'll feel better after my wine.
Maybe. What is your favorite kind of wine?

In my current relationship, there is more trust she's not insecure about me going out with friends

do they ever play justin timberlike ? i love justin timberlike !

dialogue: I went skydiving a few years ago. It was a rush!
skydiving is insane to me, how did it go? what reminded you of it?
I was watching Bob Ross, my favorite artist, paint a tree on television last night. The tree looked exactly like the one I landed in.
That's hilarious. I love Bob Ross, he's got such cool hair.
That means I have cool hair also, since I emulate obscure celebrities in every facet of my life.

Only the obscure ones. My mothers fashion line does something similar. I wish she would let me model her new line of Congressional Hairnets.
hahaha. Congressional Hairnets. I guess I could use one of those since I plan to become a nun.
Goodness gracious! Why would you want to do that? or is it Nun of my business?

That makes sense. Some monks go out in public, but most don't work. Have you ever heard of phenomenology?
No, but I assume it's the study of phenomenons. How off base am I?
They do! But mostly the phenomena of consciousness. It's interesting stuff.
Oh, I don't need to study consciousness. I already know all there is about existence. Any questions?
Wow, I don't think I'll ever be that certain about my own existence.
That is correct. You never will until we all are.

my mother has her own fashion brand.

S.E.O. (Seardh engine optimization) companies can help you get hits on youtube also. But they cost money to be effective.

MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM love me those Hershey kisses.

A pit,a blue heeler I love my dogs more than anything they are super spoiled. English,and child phycology I'm wanting to be a teacher

dialogue: I would like it longer, its past my shoulders
Ive been experimenting with letting mine grow, being male its a bit different for me, always kept it short.
Yes, you don't see many males with long hair.  Especially past the shoulders!
I understand that, attitudes about hair varies across cultures and historical periods, and age too
Definitely.  Since having kids, it seems like the 'mom' thing to do is cut your hair.  Not me I guess.
I never met my mother. I wonder if she would have cut her hair or kept it long.
Wow, it must have been difficult for you not knowing your mother.  Even the simple things like not knowing what she looked like must have been tough.
Yes it was, that is why I have dedicated my life and study to finding out what happened to her and my father.
That sounds like an interesting journey.  I'm sure it's frustrating sometimes.  Do you think you are close to finding out?
Well. The US government won't say anything, but I have come across some interesting leads in a small Russian newspaper, which lead my investigation to a library in Kabul.
Wow!  Dealing with different countries would definitely add a degree of difficulty.  Is it strange the US government won't (or can't) say anything?  That sounds very odd
It is odd! That is why I suspect that they were operatives with the CIA. But why they never came back from their last mission, I have not yet discovered.
Crazy! It sounds like a movie or TV show or video game! It would be frustrating not knowing what happened but kind of cool you have such interesting parents
Maybe I will publish a book if I am able to piece together the full story. Anonymously, of course. The government does not give up its secrets easily!

Watching fish can be relaxing. It could put you in the zone.

Ok, I guess that was a bit out of nowhere!
Lol...I'm a bit of a trivia geek.

yeah tea, knitting needles and inane knowledge. A Holy Trinity.

dialogue: Really? I lived in something similar to section 8 public housing at one point. How does section 8 work?
well its considered social housing now .. its an umbrella term referring to rental housing which may be owned and managed by the state, by non-profit organizations, or by a combination of the two
I see, that's interesting. It's good that those things exist for people who need it.
I know a woman who was actually paid 6 dollars per month to live in an apartment. That's free rent and one pack of cigarettes.
I guess so. Better than having someone homeless on the streets, especially compared to the amount of money we give billionaires for free.
True. If that guy that invented Tesla cars would give up half a billion, it'd help quite a bit.
Sure. Do you think it's weird how much of most people's income goes to paying rent?
I find renting as strange as typing with both hands. I type with one, and am starting to believe perhaps I'm in the minority on both accounts.
I think you might be right about that. Can you type fast when typing with only one hand?
20 words per minute if it's not too cold in the office. 30 words per minute if my blood is warm. Summer is the superior season.
20 wpm? That's pretty slow. Have you ever thought about learning to type with both hands online?
Oh, I can do that, but then I'd have to set down my coffee. And without the coffee I'd be typing with my face.

I did: my daughter. But she's still to young to hold the cup steady.

it is my universe , and everyone else is just a character in it.

lol  I know.  I was picking up for later.  I just like cappuccino

thats me.  my life is a drama!

action and suspense.  I really like the hunt for red October.  I watched it again last week

stealing a russian submarine.  Its a jack ryan movie.  The first one I think

Tacos, man.

You've never had an egg taco?!

Yeah, just a scrambled egg and tortilla.
I'll have to try that some time.  Sounds like a good snack for when I'm working (I draw professionally)
Wow, do you draw skaters and weirdo-people like me?
I'm a cartoonist so I absolutely draw weirdos!  Especially like you!

no.
what would you use to distract youself then, if you were in my position?

not justvwith work but i am ocd in general . everything has to be perfect and its exhausting

If you search youtube for "melody sheep"   "bill nye" you will see a most wonderful video. Watching things like this is the extent of my contribution.

dialogue: The word I ment was stale

very true. The end of Game of Thrones gutted my sensibilities for expecting quality to be consistent.
