dialogue: Someone asked me for some money to donate to their charity and I told them no. I feel so terrible but I have such a low income that I have to think about my family.
I totally understand that. Sometimes the most important charity is your own.
It's also hard with my allowance. I'm only ten years old
At 10 you shouldn't have to donate to charity, I'm already in university (UMass) studying Philosophy, and money is tight for me too.
It was for one of my friends. I have a lot of friends
You are lucky that you have alot of friends. I don't have time for friends right now, but maybe later.
What is philosophy?
It is kindof studying and thinking about life and why it is the way it is. Confusing I know.
I don't get it. But I also don't get math
Math is hard for me too, that's why I'm not studying it in Uni. What do you like in school?
I like to read a lot. Me and all my friends do
I read alot too, I think my brown eyes are best for reading, my brothers eyes are blue and he doesn't read much.
My eyes are green
Do the rest of your family have green eyes too?
speaker persona: i am ten years old.
i've a lot of friends.

dialogue: I wasn't happy today when someone ran in to the back of my moms car.
That makes a lot of sense. I wouldn't be happy either! I hope that they have good insurance
I'm not sure if she does, but gosh do I wish people were better drivers. People seemed to be a lot more apt at driving in the UK than here.
I haven't been driving for long enough to tell, but I'm sure you're right. Is your mom hurt though?
Oh yeah, she's fine. It was just a fender bender. You'll see in time, I'm sure. How long have you been driving?
I'm really happy to hear she is alright. Only for a few months! Finally passed my driving exams.
Oh wow! Have any crazy scenarios happen to you yet? How's your parallel parking skills?
There was actually a lady driving on the wrong side of the road yesterday morning! She scared me!
What?! That's crazy! How do these people get their licences? Heck, maybe *she* was from the UK!
Ha, I wouldn't be surprised if she was! I actually have it on dash cam. Are you coming over this weekend? I'll show you!
Oh wow, good thing! You should think about reporting them then. Did we make plans? I totally forgot
Like to the police? No worries, I'll give you a call later to make plans
Yeah absolutely, that kind of reckless driving shouldn't go unwarned.
Ok, I'll be sure to head to the police station with a copy of the video tonight. Cops intimidate me though haha
speaker persona: i travel often.
i live with my parents.
listener persona: i am currently looking for a job.

dialogue: I had planned to get my wife flowers for her birthday but I completly forgot. I feel very upset about having forgotten and think she'll hate me.
Is there still time to get one? You can if you hurry!
Her birthday was yesterday and I was too busy with work. She was upset that I forgot her birthday.
Well you can always get more flowers, so it'll be okay! Try making it up by bringing her food!
I have a dinner date at a fancy place she loves planned tonight. So I hope it goes well. How are you?
its going okay. I have a few dates a month. trying to take it slow to be honest. No one seems different though.
Well keep at it. You will find someone for you. What are your hobbies?
I love acting. It's always been my dream to play the big roles in films.
That is really cool! What is your favorite type of acting?
I usually like fantasy movies.  You know I get enough of the real world, so I'd like to see something fantastical to dive into people's imaginations.
I agree 100% with that. Escaping from the real world is always nice. What do you like to eat?
mac and cheese ! especially in the shape of dinosaurs .
Aw. That is cute. I like eating meat. Steak is my favorite. Do you like steak?
I do, but I would rather eat other stuff now. Steak without qualification is considered beefsteak!
speaker persona: i eat a lot of meat.
my father was also in the military.
listener persona: i'm an actress and i work at a grocery store.
i like to dress up for other people.

dialogue: i love sports than reading , are you into sports ?
not too much , what sports ?
Football mainly.
football is nice . i am more of a reader than a sports person
Me too actually.
What sort of things do you enjoy reading?
Stories about near death experiences.
That is pretty scary, is it life reaffirming for you?
Yes indeed.
I enjoy fantasy myself, takes me to wild places.
Well this stuff really happened though.
Yeah I don't like to read about real life, I already live in real life!
That's a good point.
I'm glad you do though, people like being heard!
speaker persona: i prefer reading to sports.
i've survived near death experiences.
listener persona: i like watching action adventure movies and eating popcorn.
my mother raised me since my father left when i was five years old.

dialogue: My sister and her husband are both hoarders of things.  they love to buy in bulk and just continue to keep everything they buy therefore their house is full of stuff
That kind of behavior has been associated with health risks , economic burdens, and adverse affects on loved ones. It's unfortunate.
Maybe one day I will move to London.
Wouldn't that be great. Think of all the changes we could make.
Yep. And the soccor!
I guess you'll have to get a storage unit.  The question then is what goes in the storage unit?  Furniture or the kids crafts.  Haha.
Just furniture probably.
I live with my mom. If we moved, I would have to deal with her 500 pairs of shoes. She's a hoarder for sure.
OH wow that's a lot of shoes.
500 pairs of shoes is definitely way too many.  If she was unwilling to discard the items and the shoes were covering up living areas, I would hate it.
I agree.
I have to be careful travelling to new countries though. I am allergic to shellfish and cats.
There are cats everywhere.
Oh wow. I would have to avoid them. Do you have pets?
speaker persona: i love soccer.
i want to move to london when i get older.
listener persona: my mother has 500 pairs of shoes.
i'm allergic to shellfish and cats.

dialogue: yes i have
Its more conscious and emotional feelings. When you are identify that in you
I just wish I could have gone farther in archery, you know?
You can learn eventually. How come you stopped?
Kids are expensive.
I don't have any myself, but I can only imagine. How many kids do you have?
Just a daughter. I must admit, I spoil her.
That's fantastic. Do you plan on having more kids eventually? Nothing wrong with spoiling.
I would love to have more kids, actually. What about you? Any plans of having children?
I would love to one day. My girlfriend wants 5, but i'm thinking that's too many personally. lol
Oh my gosh, that would be a lot of work! I don't think I could have that many, personally, but to each their own!
I think two is the perfect number. I grew up with one brother, and that worked out well I think. haha. How many would you like to have?
Not sure, honestly. I grew up with two sisters and a brother, and I thought that was a good number as well. Maybe I'm partial because I'm number 3.
They say the third time is the charm. You must be the favorite child
Definitely ;)
speaker persona: i like to shoot a bow.
i like to go shopping with my daughters.
listener persona: i wish i could take back a mistake.

dialogue: i've never been there but would love to go too
i know what other places would you like to visit ?
I have heard they have a big swimming pool there.
Really? How big is it?
I think they used it in the Olympics so it must be pretty big!
Wow! I love to run but have never been very good at swimming, I would like to get better.
It takes a lot of practice, I love swimming. How often do you run?
Every day, its an important part ofmy routine. Do you run?
I have done in the past but have fallen out of the habit. I should really start again.
You should, it feels great and is amazing for your health
We moved when my parents split up and I haven't looked for routes around my new house. Maybe I'll go for a run tomorrow morning!
I think that's a great idea!Make sure you stretch first!
Haha yeah, don't want to get injured on my first run!
Yeah, you probably better. And just start slow on the small hills.
speaker persona: i like to go swimming.
my parents are not married anymore.

dialogue: my wife is amazing, shes the only one i want
Sounds like you lucked out, make sure she knows how special she is :)
I always try my best.
That is sweet!
Yeah, being comfortable around another person is so relaxing.
It is! Do you have children?
Yes, I have two children 8 and 10.
Oh wonderful! Boys or Girls?
speaker persona: my parents used to work in politics , until they discovered the goodness within themselves.
i don t like wearing pants when i don t have to.
listener persona: i live a nomadic lifestyle and travel frequently.
i work remotely as a programmer.

dialogue: I have a toothache today but no time to get to the dentist.
I am sorry to hear that.  Do you have any meds that could help relieve the pain?
I have picked up a few, I'm just hoping they start working soon.
what kind of meds? something like xanax?
Just general painkillers, mainly ibuprofen for now. It should help numb the pain until I can schedule a dentist appointment.
that should work.  I never go to the dentist because I am afraid to talk to them.
What do you find fearful about dentists?
I don't find dentists scary specifically, I find everyone scary because I have autism
Ah, that's fair, I assure you people are not as bad as they seem, I've never personally ran into an issue with any medical staff before.
Yes I am sure it would be fine, I just find them intimidating
Everyone gets a bit worried when talking to certain people, a smile can usually go a long way though.
speaker persona: i ride a unicycle.
my favorite band is metallica.
listener persona: people in school said i was quiet.

dialogue: yes , i can make you a meal with my fresh vegetables !
i love to cook . . . i lately discovered costco to shop at . . . love it
How long have you been cooking?
It's been about 5 years now. I've learned so much since I first started.
Interesting...what inspired you to start cooking
I started as a way to keep in shape, especially since it requires a lot of strength, endurance, and flexibility.
Yes it does. I have slowed down over the years but I still cherish my fresh vegetables.
What meats and vegetables do you like?
I love brocolli, carrots, chicken, and fish. What about you?
Yeah, broccoli is the best vegetable. I really love to eat it raw as well.
Me too!... dip it in ranch and enjoy!
I love ranch dressing too. It is my favorite to dip with. It has been the best selling salad dressing in the US since 1992.
That's an interesting fact. I wonder what people used before ranch became so popular...
probably something bland
I agree. I can't imagine raw broccolli without ranch
speaker persona: i love all sorts of fresh vegetables.
i am seventy one years old.
listener persona: i work a dead end 9 to 5 job as a snakeskin oil salesman.
my favorite store to shop at is costco.

dialogue: Oh really? what kind of effects does it have? I am all for benefits!
It is especially good for people with high blood pressure
That's great, I should mention that when selling mine at the market
Yes, beetroot has many benefits, I juice mine with apples and carrots daily and love it!
That sounds really good. Do you ever add any spices or anything?
Not really mostly lemons, kale or greens of some kind.
I could never put kale in it, but I'd like to try adding lemons
You really can't taste the kale, as the kale has calcium and great benefits as well as the beetroot.
No kale for me, but if you enjoy it that's great!
lol, to each there own I have heard beetroot is good for the kidneys?
Yeah, probably helps circulation quite a bit.
I bet, I know when cutting it up it can stain easily.
Super easily. You can boil beets to dye fabric though, which is pretty cool
I've heard of that as well with makeup, lol
speaker persona: i live on a beet farm.
i think beets are the best vegetable.
listener persona: i read a lot of used books.
i work in a flower shop.

dialogue: not much , i blog about my aquarium . do you do anything fun ?
i just play on the computer . do you have interesting fish ?
I have a few blue tang, which is fun. My niece loves Finding Nemo
i love kids movies . i like finding nemo !
speaker persona: my mom raised me by herself and taught me to play baseball.
i will one day own a ferret.
listener persona: playing quake on slackware linux makes me happy.
i've three dogs and two cats.

dialogue: I'm going back to college which is really bittersweet.
I'm sorry?
I think that was a typo.  What did you study in college?
Well when I started, I studied typing, but that was almost forty years ago!
I didn't know that typing was a college major. We finally got some cool weather here. I'm happy because winter is my favorite season.
Are you getting any snow soon where you are?
Nah. I live in the south. We rarely get snow. I'm glad though because we can't ski. I'm so afraid of heights.
I am sorry to hear that, I love snow. It's flat where I live, so no skiing here either.
What do you like to do in your spare time? Have you ever traveled to a National Park?
No, I always mean to. In my spare time, I like to travel, went to DC most recently for museums.
I love the museum of National History. Did you see Dorothy's shoes?
I mostly wound up at the human exhibits through time, I did not get to see the shoes. A shame, I grew up in kansas.
Oh really. Are you a Les Miles fan?
speaker persona: i'm an old woman.
my grandsons favorite type of cake is chocolate.
listener persona: i am deathly terrified of heights.
winters my favorite time of the year.

dialogue: i was mad the other day when i saw someone had put a huge dent in my car door!
That sounds terrible
yes i will support
same
yes thanks
No problem I hope everything works out
ok thanks i will support
good
thanks work nice
I really am serious about this sport and I hope to go far with it.
speaker persona: my favorite color is blue.
i drive a four wheel drive vehicle.
listener persona: i hope to keep improving and go big with this sport.
i noticed i m very talented for this sport.

dialogue: I'm feeling a little down since my wife will be gone for the weekend.
That's unfortunate. What are you going to do to keep yourself busy all weekend?
I'm not sure maybe order some chinese food and find a good book.
You could learn to cook chinese food. New experiences are always good.
I could do that, and surprise her with my new skill when she comes home.
I'm sure she'll love it! What type of books are you into?
Mysteries mostly.  You?
I love mysteries, but lately I've been reading the Berenstain Bears books, at the insistence of my child! They're illustrated children's novels like those in the
My children love those.  Such good lessons in each.
I agree, the mysteries are great! It's also nice how the author can either stick to facts or be highly speculative. Makes for some varied reading.
Very true, however I believe technology has ruined the modern mystery,
How do you think technology has ruined the modern mystery?
much less leg work and creative thinking.
Good point. Do you do anything creative?
speaker persona: i really like cake and do not prefer vegetables.
i have one sister and a niece and nephew.
listener persona: my idea of flirting is to stare from a distance.
my favorite singer is jacob sartorius.

dialogue: I hate the ocean. I am very scared.
That's..intriguing. Is there any particular reason why you're scared of the ocean?
i have had a traumatic experience where i fell off of a fishing boat once
That's so sad! I'm sorry it happened. What do you do for work?
Currently i'm a production floor factory worker
That's cool. I'm trying to open my own grocery store
That's very entrepreneurial of you. Where are you going to open it ?
I hope by the end of the year
i'd like to venture into my own business one day
It's hard but rewarding. I have some challenges like being color blind
speaker persona: i can be quite forgetful.
my favorite food is spaghetti and meatballs.
listener persona: i'm currently trying to open my own grocery store.

dialogue: well , i know how to count the cards , and i'm a dealer on the blackjack table
cool ! i'm thinking about investing into a company
what company?
It is with the Disney Corporation.
that sounds like a wise investment
True, I'm not one to take many risks.
maybe i should invest too, it might help me get through casino manager school
That sounds interesting, how much longer do you have to go?
6 more years to go
Oh wow, is it very hard?
not really, i count cards for four hours straight
Oh really, I bet you are great in math?
i like to think so
Well good luck to you and any investments you make!
thank you!...you as well..do you have any tips?
speaker persona: i am a blackjack dealer.
i am currently going back to school to try and become a casino manager.
listener persona: i always sleep 8 hours a day.

dialogue: aw , thank you so much , you are really nice
thank you people tell me i'm great
Haha, I'm sure they do. So, what do you like to do for fun?
My number on passion is photography.  But, I try to just have a lot of fun regardless of what I do.
Thats awesome, and the best way to live life. I love playing tennis, but I'm not all that great at it, if I'm honest.
Tennis is a hard sport. There is so much running.
Surprisingly, yes. For such a little area, you sure do run a lot.
I try to run a 10K each year.  What is your favorite color?
I love the color blue. What's your favorite?
Really! That's my favorite as well.
Thats awesome! Do you own your own place, or do you rent?
We are working on paying off our mortgage. You?
Same, actually. Cheaper than renting an apartment, and I can sing as loud and obnoxiously as I want to.
What kind of music do you like?
speaker persona: i am an aspiring singer.
i enjoy playing tennis.

dialogue: I know right. Some people I guess. I have a couple dogs but they're at my parents place.
They are so loyal and playful and loveable, some of the best companions in the world.
Yeah. When I play fortnite when I come back from the elementary school, little Tux comes and sits on my lap, it's adorable!
Aww, how cute. I want to meet your little fluffers. I bet she is a great companion and is good at aiding you.
You can come over this weekend. I'm sure they'll love you! Do you have any pets?
I do, a cat! Over the last few decades in Japan, we've started to adopt pets as more than utilitarian and more into our family system.
Oh wow! What color is it? Also, what does utilitarian mean?
It's black. Utilitarian means being more useful than appearance.
Oh ok! I'll try and include that one in my next short story for my teacher. It must be very pretty! Can you show me a picture later?
I would love to but we can't share images on here :(
Aww that's okay I understand :( Do you play any games?
Yes I do! I build all my computers and deck it out with the latest hardware to play minecraft
Really?! That is so cool! I wish my parents would let me have my own computer. They think it would a bad influence.
It can but it can also help you out on academics as well. It's like a double edged sword.
speaker persona: i love dogs and cats.
i'm ten years old.

dialogue: I just took the bar exam this week.
That is great how do you think you did?
I think I did really well, i knew all of the right stuff to pass.
that's great i'm glad to hear it
I do however think I eat to much meat. I should probably try to eat less meat since it is not great for the environment.
I have so many questions about thie segue, your bar exam certification got you thinking about yor meat consumption?
it made me think about a lot of environmental problems that are going on right now and meat consumption is a big one, at least on an individual level.
How did it do that? Was there an ethical question component or something?
There is a part that looks at your character and it just got me thinking of a lot of different things about myself.
I think systemically we ought to be pushing to address more dire environmental impacts instead of compartmentalizing small dietary choices, hoping they have the scale necessary
Well with most of the current administration being climate deniers i do think anything is going to change very soon.
Well, hopefully with smart educated minds like yours entering the law profession we can change that - and soon. I'm excited about the impact of EVs!
Yeah I think a Tesla is my dream car at this point.
More a corevette for me! I would give anything for an electric corvette - something like that would just make my life utterly complete.
speaker persona: i like meat too much.
i m lazy and pork tastes good.
listener persona: i need a corvette to complete my life.

dialogue: i could eat pasta everyday , and i love chicken too
cool ! what do you do for a living again ?
I am a professional poker player,  I like to read to my cats in my freetime
I am not good at poker, but I do like to play for fun.
I like to use my poker winnings to buy tuna.  It's my favorite food.
That's interesting! I wish I could have tuna, but I'm allergic. What else do you buy?
I like to buy things for my cats,  other than that I just pay my bills and play more poker
You have some lucky kitties! Have cat food prices gone up? Dog food prices are ridiculous!
Yes my cat has to eat science diet food as well so it is especially expensive
That is an expensive food. I guess you win a lot of money playing poker?
I make a decent amount average is around 20-30 dollars an hour
I wish I could make that kind of money. That could get you a lot where I'm from.
Yes it is quite the fortunate position to be in.
Do you play poker online to make that money?
speaker persona: my cats like to be read to.
i like to eat tune.

dialogue: I am not a butcher by any stretch, so always cut.  What about you?
I usually buy them whole if I am having a big party, because it saves a lot of money, but I will eat them any way I can get them.  Do you have any other favorite cuts?
I prefer sirloin. What about yourself? I also am prone to demanding my meat rare. I want to hear it moo.
I'm a prime rib kind of guy myself. I like my steak medium though. I had it rare once and it made me sick
Oh, sorry to hear that! It isn't for everyone, I guess. So what do you do for a living? Or are you in school?
Unfortunately I'm not working right now. But I plan on going back to school in the spring what about you?
Are you majoring in anything in particular?
I'm trying to get a cybersecurity certification actually.  I don't have the cash for a 4 year school but computers pay out big!
So I've heard. My boyfriend is into computers. I'm a little clueless myself. What is cybersecurity?
I guess the best way to put it is to say its like the protection of networks. Keep people out that need to be out
That sounds cool, actually. Have you ever been hacked? That is one experience I don't want to have again.
I was on facebook a few years back. Aside from that no. My parents have been hacked a few times though
Is that part of the reason why you're interested in cybersecurity? As long as I never get my identity stolen, I won't complain.
Of course! people put so much information online and I want to help protect it
speaker persona: my dad is a dentist and my mom is a teacher.
my major is in business administration.
listener persona: i do not know how to swim.

dialogue: Chocolate makes people happy, don't you agree?
I think Chocolate is a key to happiness! It's so sweet, those roasted cacao seeds are a blessing for us.
We have a chocolate factory in the town where i leave. I think it feeds my love of chocolate.
Have you ever had the seeds from the cacao tree? Before they are processed they are pretty bitter and are fermented before being processed into chocolate.
No I have not. Where do you purchase them?
they came to argentina where i am from and i met them in a drugstore .
You met who in a drugstore?
Sorry, I got the cacao seeds there.
Ah I see. I've never seen them in a drug store around here. I will ask my twin sister though. She works at a drug store.
If you can't find them locally, you can always find them online.
That's a good idea. I do a lot of shopping on amazon. Have you started Christmas shopping yet?
No, but I need to get started.  Have you?
Yes, I have a few people done already. I still have a lot left though.
We still have plenty of time, but it goes by fast this time of year.
speaker persona: i've a twin sister.
i love chocolate.
listener persona: i live in a small city.

dialogue: I saw an old photo of my mom this morning. It made me miss the old times
That's always fun to look at pictures.
I know! The memories can be really sweet!
Do you get to see your mom often?
Not often, she lives far away
sO SAD,  i DON'T KNOW WHAT i WOULD DO WITHOUT MY MOTHER HERE.
Really? You two are close?
We are very close
Has it always been like that for you two?
Yes, but even more so once I had kids of my own.
So she helps a lot?
Oh yes and my kids adore her. They call her fairy Grandmother
Thats so cute!!! How many kids do you have?
2.  Do you hve any?
speaker persona: i'm a widow.
my parents were divorced.
listener persona: i run more then 2 miles a day even though i hate it.

dialogue: That's amazing! I don't think I have heard his music
His music most revolves around racial, social, and inner city issies.
What is your favorite song of his?
Oh, man, that's tough. I guess today my answer would be Dear Mama.
I'll have to look that one up. I like listening to new music, expanding my horizons.
We need more musicians like him - he was really about the music. There's way too much commercial garbage on the radio these days.
That's so true. Aside from Tupac, who is your favorite artist?
I've got pretty diverse taste. It's hard to pin down a favorite. Lately I've been listening to a lot of Johnny Cash, though.
He's such a classic. As I've gotten older, I appreciate his music even more.
Absolutely. His voice is legendary.
So distinctive. His version of "Hurt" always gives me goosebumps.
It's a great one. I like how he managed to stay relevant up until the day he died. His life story is inspiring, too.
Yes, it is. He seemed to be a good man - he knew he wasn't perfect, but he tried his best.
He did. I like stories like that - people who aren't perfect but do the best they can.
speaker persona: my favorite artist is 2pac.
my favorite song is california love.
listener persona: at night , i party hard in the atlanta club scene , and i never miss a music festival.

dialogue: Really? What are the first and second?
It's only behind Water and Tea
What's your favorite kind of beer?
I like IPA, they are usually better in bottles though,
I agree. I prefer glass bottles over cans for any drink.
Same, but cans are useful at the beach or really any outdoor function that isn't in someone's backyard.
That's true.
I wouldn't mind being on a beach with a drink in hand. This colder weather is already bumming me out.
I usually don't mind the cold weather too much until it starts to snow.
I really only like the cold weather because of snow.
I don't mind the snow, I just don't like driving in it
The right tires makes all the difference.
Also a vehicle with moderate ground clearance doesn't hurt either.
True and a capable driver.
speaker persona: i played football in high school.
i always have a beer after work.

dialogue: I do not like the taste, texture or thought of eating meat.
So it has nothing to do with whether or not eating meat is ethical? There is a lot of debate around the ethics of eating meat.
Well, I stopped eating it at first because of the taste, but the ethics makes me even happier with my decision.
same
Have you ever read "Eating Animals"? It's a great book and had me thinking a lot. It's about the animal agriculture industry.
I actually have! I am a big advocate against animal cruelty.
Oh that's great! Me too. I want to get involved with local activism.
I agree. More people should get involved to make a change.
Yeah, I agree. I think most people care, but they just don't know how to help.
There not a lot we can do.Maybe presure the local politicians
That's true. Anything helps. It's hard to change something that has been the same for so many years.
If we could just get more people on board to do that we would be on the right track.
I agree! I always like to share what I know with other people, but some people get upset when they hear about the cruelty behind meat.
its graphic but needs to be known
speaker persona: i don t eat meat.
i read tons of books.

what was that like?
It was very tiring at first but I got the hang of it and it's really relaxing.
good to hear, what do you do in it?
I meditate and try to get the life energy to flow within me. This eases me.
sounds pleasant. i wish i had the time to relax as such.
just being aware of the moment is a kind of meditation . helps calm the spirit .
thanks for the advice, i'll make good use of it in the future. what do you like to do in your free time?

There are many versions, but the traditional recipe has butter, brown and white sugar, chocolate chips and vanilla. Good stuff.

You should - there are loads of recipes online and it tastes so much better than store bought
I want to make some too, I have heard adding a little shortening with the butter helps.

That's pretty neat to have 2 moms. Except your brother being outnumbered by estrogen, ha ha.

Yes, better to be alone than having to fight with someone all the time.
I hope I didn't overstep by asking that question. I'm just curious. If my parents keep it up, I'm afraid that might be our future.
It's always hard when families break up. However, if everybody tries to respect the others, it can end up being even better for all.

dialogue: How can I trust again when I have ben cheated on thrice

Scuba diving sounds fun.  We do two book clubs together.  One is for non-fiction, and one is for fiction. We also travel.

Wow! We went to Grand Canyon last summer. I lived there for 5 years, so we went back to see friends. Ireland! That sounds great.
We would love to do a cross country road trip.  Grand Canyon sounds fun.

Pedal-Driven Bicycles and Dolls.

You.
